fields.description:
Hi,

 

I'd like to help getting {{pyarrow==0.16.0}} released for Windows Python 3.5.
 I have seen the issue here: [https://ci.appveyor.com/project/Ursa-Labs/crossbow/builds/27848124]
 I'm not familiar with your release build procedure, but I have been trying to follow [https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/docs/source/developers/python.rst#building-on-windows]
 Note that I have replaced:
 {{conda create -y -n pyarrow-dev -c conda-forge ^
 --file arrow\ci\conda_env_cpp.yml ^
 --file arrow\ci\conda_env_python.yml ^
 --file arrow\ci\conda_env_gandiva.yml ^
 python=3.7}}
 with
 {{conda create -y -n pyarrow-dev -c conda-forge ^
 --file arrow\ci\conda_env_cpp.yml ^
 --file arrow\ci\conda_env_python.yml ^
 --file arrow\ci\conda_env_gandiva.yml ^
 python=3.5}}
 I also had to update {{Cython}} manually and that {{python setup.py build_ext --inplace}} seemed to do nothing, so I tried doing {{pip wheel -w dist .}} and this successfully built a wheel file for me.

I understand that {{ursabot}} is down, but when it comes back could you retry building the missing wheel? It is possible that this dependency issue is already resolved.

If I am wrong about the build procedure please let me know, I'm really unfamiliar with Windows development and your build procedure.
fields.summary: [Python] Build 0.16.0 wheel install for Windows + Python 3.5 and publish to PyPI

comments.body: Note: I have opened this issue based on: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5569

We don't need ursabot to build the wheel. It would be good to run all the unit tests on Windows on Python 3.5 to make sure something isn't broken there. I can't look at it today but if someone else with a properly configured Windows VM or machine can kick the tires and provide a wheel someone with write access to PyPI can upload it

Try cleaning out the Python directory ({{git clean -fdx .}}). See our Windows build script here

https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/dev/tasks/python-wheels/win-build.bat

The ideal situation would be to build the wheel using Crossbow so we're using the exact same configuration as for the other wheels. [~kszucs] do you want to try?
Nvm, I figured it out the compilation process and it still fails.

As far as i can remember the windows build had package conflicts since conda doesn't maintain 3.5 packages anymore. 

I doubt that we can use conda-forge in building py35 windows wheels and nut sure what would be the easy workaround.
I'll try to build the wheel locally on my Windows box
[~wesm] Did you make any progress on this? Not having a Python 3.5 Windows wheel for pyarrow is causing azureml-sdk some issues. Cheers.
Sorry, I'm sick right now (just a cold, not covid19). I'll try to give the build a try and report back
No worries, just wanted to know if it was gonna get uploaded imminently or if we need to switch back to depending on 0.15.*. We tried to bump to 0.16.0 for Python 3.8 support.
I'm attempting a bundled build of all the dependencies (because conda-forge stopped supporting Python 3.5 -- we had been using that to create the wheels).
Thank you! Sounds mighty annoying to get working.

Here is a candidate 3.5 wheel that I built locally

https://drive.google.com/open?id=1_hvgnMafWOZSgPCldNjp6iIiW3tCLwvX

It doesn't have:

* Flight
* Gandiva
* Brotli, LZ4, or ZSTD (it has Snappy and ZLIB though)

I had to comment out some lines about bundling zlib.dll because with {{-DZLIB_SOURCE=BUNDLED}}, zlib is statically linked with {{arrow.dll}}. 

I tested out the wheel locally by running the Python test suite and it looks good to me. I'll wait about 24 hours for feedback and then upload to PyPI is all looks good
We are mitigating the issue on our end by depending on `pyarrow==0.15.*` for `python<3.6`.
[~wesm] What validation can I run that will help with getting the wheel to pypi? Is there a doc describing how to run the tests you ran locally?
Can you test your software with it?

I ran a bunch of our 'scenario' notebooks against this wheel. Saw no issues, we mostly use pyarrow to read partitions of Feather and concatenate the tables together to then turn into a pandas DataFrame.
[~wesm] If bundling works then we should setup a crossbow task for it. Do you have your build script locally?
I'll create a PR with a modified version of win-build.bat and we can try to get that working in Crossbow
Just uploaded to PyPI. I'll open a follow up JIRA for the 3.5 Windows build script
Thank you Wes! This saved some messy patches on our side. Hope you get well soon!

Thank you so much, Wes!

Get better! :)
